description.p: The dbPager Server reads configuration directives from a file /etc/dbpager/dbpager.conf on startup. The configuration file is also used by all dbPager software.
The configuration file is a simple collection of variable declarations. If the configuration file parser encounters either ; or # for it ignores the rest of the line until its end.
For the settings that take a boolean argument, the values true, yes, on and 1 are equivalent, resp. false, no, off and 0.

All configuration directives are documented in the configuration file itself by the comments. Moreover, dbPager Server package includes the documentation (The User's Guide) in HTML format, available at /usr/share/doc/dbpager. Refer to that manual for details in configuration file options.
Visit the web site at http://dbpager.org.ru for more information, downloads and community support resources.
